messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] war/ history/movies
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/19/2002 1:37:11 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Me too!  Well, I don t like blowing things up. I DO like battle scenes. I try to put myself
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/19/2002 1:37:11 AM Eastern Standard Time,
mummyone24@... writes:
> Gee, I must have been a man in another life. I love movies with a lot of
> action and blowing things up and I love blood and guts. I hate when things
> are in the dark and I can't see what's going on. It's a very rare thing for
>
> me to want to see a chick flick. I guess that's just another thing that
> makes my marriage work so well. <BG>
>

Me too! Well, I don't like blowing things up. I DO like battle scenes. I try
to put myself there. It's horribly gory and bloody. Of course, I always say
I'd be the one pretending to have been hit and lying VERY still until it was
over. (Totally worthless in war!) We visited Gettysburg and Petersburg; I can
just imagine the scenes! I loved the Burn's series and the movie made out of
The Killer Angels. The Patriot (filmed here in Camden). Braveheart. WWII and
Napoleanic reinactments. I'm not as wild about the VietNam war--that creeps
me out.

The glorified parts of war are completely out of my grasp---but the realities
hit SO close. I can smell the rotting flesh and the blood and taste the
metallic air. I can feel the snow or the sun. And hear the voices. The
battlefields of VA are hauntingly "THERE". But I felt the same in Dachau.
(Been there yet, Brenda? It's a trip you'll never forget!)

My husband's the chick flick KING! <G>

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
